about.title: About IQ Test - Intelligence Assessment
about.intro: IQ (Intelligence Quotient) is a measure of human intellectual ability, developed to assess cognitive abilities such as logic, mathematics, language and spatial reasoning.

what_is_iq.title: What is IQ?
what_is_iq.content: IQ (Intelligence Quotient) is an index used to measure human intelligence. The average IQ score of the population is 100, with a standard deviation of 15. This means that about 68% of the population has an IQ of 85-115, and only about 2% has an IQ above 130.

how_it_works.title: How does the test work?
how_it_works.content: Our test consists of 10 questions designed to assess different cognitive abilities: logical thinking, pattern recognition, mathematical reasoning, and spatial ability. Each question has different difficulty levels and is scored according to international standards.

pattern.title: Pattern Recognition
pattern.description: Tests ability to identify patterns in sequences or shapes

mathematical.title: Mathematical Reasoning
mathematical.description: Evaluates calculation skills and numerical reasoning

spatial.title: Spatial Thinking
spatial.description: Tests ability to visualize and rotate 3D objects

verbal.title: Verbal Reasoning
verbal.description: Assesses vocabulary knowledge and language relationships

accuracy.title: Accuracy
accuracy.content: Our test is designed based on modern psychological research and has been validated with thousands of participants. However, this is only a preliminary assessment tool and cannot replace professional IQ tests.
